title: Christian Conduct and Salvation
shortSummary: Titus chapter 3 instructs believers on proper Christian behavior, emphasizing submission to authorities, kindness, and good works. It also highlights the transformative power of God's mercy through salvation by grace, not works, encouraging believers to avoid divisive disputes and maintain faithfulness.
timeline: c. AD 63 - Paul's pastoral guidance to Titus during the early church period

keyCharacters.name: Titus
keyCharacters.description: A trusted companion of Paul, tasked with leading and instructing the church in Crete, receiving pastoral guidance in this chapter.

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle who writes this letter, providing doctrinal teaching and practical instructions for church order and Christian living.

keyCharacters.name: Artemas
keyCharacters.description: A fellow worker mentioned as a potential visitor to Titus, indicating ongoing ministry partnerships.

keyCharacters.name: Tychicus
keyCharacters.description: Another associate of Paul, referenced as a possible envoy to Titus, showing the network of early Christian leaders.

keyCharacters.name: Zenas the lawyer
keyCharacters.description: A Christian mentioned as needing assistance on his journey, highlighting the importance of supporting ministry workers.

keyCharacters.name: Apollos
keyCharacters.description: A well-known Christian teacher who is also traveling and requires support, demonstrating cooperation among early believers.

definitions.definition: Spiritual and earthly authorities or governing powers to whom Christians are instructed to be subject.
A phrase describing the spiritual rebirth and cleansing that occurs through the Holy Spirit at salvation.
A person who promotes false teachings or doctrines contrary to orthodox Christian faith.
Declared righteous before God, a legal standing granted through faith in Jesus Christ by God's grace.

outline.heading: Instructions for Christian Behavior
outline.description: Paul urges Titus to remind believers to respect governing authorities, avoid slander and quarrels, and to show gentleness and humility toward all.

outline.heading: The Past Condition and Salvation by God's Mercy
outline.description: A contrast is drawn between the believers' former sinful state and the salvation brought by God's kindness, mercy, and the renewing work of the Holy Spirit through Jesus Christ.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Good Works and Avoidance of Divisions
outline.description: Believers are encouraged to maintain good works as a natural fruit of faith, while avoiding unprofitable disputes and rejecting persistent heretics.

outline.heading: Personal Instructions and Final Greetings
outline.description: Paul informs Titus about sending helpers, encourages hospitality and diligence in good works, and closes with greetings and a blessing of grace.

application: Submit respectfully to governmental authorities as part of Christian witness and obedience to God.
Cultivate a gentle and humble spirit, avoiding quarrels and speaking evil of others to reflect Christ's love.
Rely on God's mercy and grace for salvation, not on personal works, and live in the hope of eternal life.
Be vigilant against false teachings and maintain faithfulness to sound doctrine while actively doing good works.

keyVerses.text: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores salvation as a gift of God's mercy, not human effort, highlighting the necessity of spiritual renewal.

keyVerses.text: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the importance of good works as evidence of genuine faith and beneficial for the Christian community.

keyVerses.text: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;
keyVerses.significance: This verse provides clear guidance on dealing with persistent false teachers to protect the purity of the church.
